data.title: Hidden Gem – Brand New Curated Home w Pool Access
data.description: Superbly designed for living, relaxing and entertaining – this remarkable townhome has everything that you need! The calming color palette with warm wooden furniture and playful jewel-toned accent pieces gives the home a grounded and serenely relaxing atmosphere. Interior highlights include three spacious bedrooms with plush new mattresses and walk-in closets, a luxurious ensuite primary bathroom, and a cozy living area with plenty of comfortable seating. Whether you are searching for a retirement getaway, interim family home, or a full-service getaway – this brand-new townhome in the intimate Mosaic neighborhood is the perfect choice!Enjoy the best of Fort Collins, right out your door! This beautiful, new townhome is centrally located and perfect for those looking to experience the true atmosphere of Fort Collins. Head up to Lory State Park and explore the hiking/biking trails, hop over to Odell for a cold fresh beer, or head downtown for an evening of live music and culinary delights. Then head home for a relaxing evening in your home away from home! You will love this intimate community within 10 minutes of the brewery district, Old Town Fort Collins and CSU. Conveniently located between Old Town and I-25, this brand-new townhome is the perfect choice for an extended stay in Fort Collins!This home features: Bedroom 1: King Bed (second level) | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed (second level) | Bedroom 3: Twin Trundle Bed (second level) | Sleeps 6 OUTDOOR LIVING:  Main level patio with a small bistro table and mountain views! There is also a community pool that is open May – September, a short 5-minute walk from this townhome! INDOOR LIVING:  Smart TV, dining table with seating for 6, laptop-friendly workspace KITCHEN:  Fully equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances, dishwasher, microwave, breakfast bar with seating for 2, cooking basics, dishware/flatware, spices, complimentary coffee, creamer, tea and sweetener BATHROOMS:  There is a main floor half bath and two bathrooms on the upper level. We include hair dryers, soap, shampoo and conditioner for every guest stay. GENERAL:  High-speed WiFi, washer/dryer, linens/towels, keyless entry, central heating and air conditioning, complimentary toiletries, iron/board and cleaning essentials.  PARKING:  Two car garage and street parking is also available HOUSE RULES: No smokingNo events, parties, or large gatherings PET POLICY:  Dogs Welcome...We love dogs! However... all pets must be pre-approved (no aggressive breeds) and a pet fee will be due at booking. Unapproved pets and excessive barking or aggression are grounds for removal of pets from the property or eviction of tenants.  COMMUNITY POOL:  The community pool is open from Memorial Day to Labor Day! If your stay falls within that period, you will have access to the community pool which is conveniently located a 5-minute walk down the road. Pass is required.  NOTE:  This property is located near the Fort Collins train line which run through downtown. The train is part of the history and economy of Fort Collins and is an integral part of what Fort Collins is today. The train may be heard occasionally during your stay.   Mountain Time Vacation Rentals  is owned and operated by locals with a passion for hospitality and our amazing mountain community.  We have over 100 homes to choose from which can accommodate groups of 2 to 200.  Our Commitment to Clean: All homes and linens are professionally cleaned, sanitized, and disinfected before each and every guest. Feel free to send us an inquiry so we can help you plan the perfect getaway!

A Hidden Paradise - Bungalow 1
data.description: Welcome to Hidden Paradise! Ready for an unforgettable vacation? Bungalow #1 is a lovely home perfect of up to 6 guests. Located just a short walk from the beautiful crystal sands and community pool, this home is directly in the heart of the vibrant South Siesta Key Village. Relax by the shared community pool located at the Calini Beach Club or venture on a stroll to the beach. With 13 public beach access points, wonderful shops and restaurants, Siesta Key promises great experiences for everyone who visits. Take advantage of the tranquil waters, soft sand, and warm sun as you explore all the island has to offer and unwind at the end of a fantastic day in this beautiful home.Bedding and Televisions:Bedroom 1 - King, TVBedroom 2 - TwinsLiving room - Sleeper Sofa, TVUnit Size - 624 Sq. Ft.Added Amenities Included in Your Stay:Complimentary Bicycles Rentals,One Complimentary Parking Space,Wifi,Beach Chairs,Beach Towels,Beach Wagon,Beach Cooler,Partner Property Pool/Hot tub Access,Access to Siesta Beach Pickleball Courts,Siesta Key Trolley - Free-Rides Around Siesta Key,A 7-day week, Beachside Management office for your convenience and guest needs!Minimum Age Requirement: 23*Minimum age requirement from February 1st through April 15th for all Beachside Managed properties is 27 years of age

data.title: A Las Palmas
data.description: Welcome to Las Palmas! This gorgeous new home on Siesta Key offers luxury around every turn. Stay with up to 16 guests in this 7-bedroom, 7.5-bathroom home, complete with a private pool and spa area, fenced in yard, large full kitchen, dining room, two living spaces with a game room, and much more! Spend time outside by the pool, featuring a kid’s slide, rain curtain, pool fountains, and hot tub, all conveniently position by the patio lounge area with a BBQ grill, Mini Fridge and plenty of space for everyone to relax. Located around the corner form Siesta Key Village, this home sits across the street from beach access numbers 8 and 9. Guests can gaze out at the ocean and enjoy beautiful sunset skies from the rooftop patio or take the short walk into the Village for the many wonder shops and restaurants Siesta Key has to offer. Capture your piece of paradise with this fabulous new home. *Events possible upon request.Bedding and Televisions:Bedroom 1 – King, TVBedroom 2 – King, TVBedroom 3 – King, TVBedroom 4 – King, TVBedroom 5 – King, TVBedroom 6 – King, TVBedroom 7 – Double Twin Bunk Beds,Living Room 1 – TVLiving Room 2 – TVUnit Size - 5,000 Sq. data.title: A Tide that Binds Us - 600
data.description: Spend your vacation relaxing in this lovely 3-bedroom, 2.5-bathroom townhome. On the ground level, you will find covered parking for up to 2 cars, and storage. The second level hosts an open concept for the living room, dining, and kitchen areas. The spacious living room features rattan ceiling panels for a casual coastal vibe. The kitchen offers plenty of storage and stainless countertops. On this floor, you will also find a powder room and a balcony for enjoying the fresh island breeze. The 3 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms are located on the third level. The master bedroom includes 2 bathing areas, one of which is open to the bedroom and has a jetted bathtub. Located within walking distance to Siesta Key Village, this home is adjacent to beach access #10 – perfect for taking a trip down to Siesta Beach! *This property is stairs only; all guests must have the ability to use stairs.Bedroom 1 – KingBedroom 2 – QueenBedroom 3 – Two DoublesLivingroom – Queen Sleeper SofaUnit Size - 1,292 Sq. The second level hosts a spacious living room, dining, and kitchen areas. The kitchen offers plenty of storage and stainless countertops. The 3 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, and second balcony are located on the third level. data.title: Beach Residences On Siesta, aka The Hyatt
data.description: Siesta Key’s only luxury hotel. Sitting directly on Siesta’s Quartz Beach that offers the whitest and softest sand in the World that is always cool to the touch. Relaxing and making your memories is all that’s required but located just minutes is down town’s rich art and cultural community. In the village of Siesta, you’ll be welcomed to enjoy a cool beverage under the palm trees while listening to live music, take a stroll while you shop, or find many great local cuisines. Make sure to look for the local dolphins frolicking in our crystal-clear waters of the Gulf of Mexico. Siesta Key beach, rated #1 in the country. The memories will linger long after your footprints in the sand have been washed away by the gentle waves.Our stunning accommodations need to be experienced to be believed. The spacious floor plan is perfect for family vacations. Our suite is well appointed to 5-star standards and resort-quality amenities including multiple flat screen TVs, Bose® sound systems, jetted oversized bathtubs and multi-head rain showers, king-size Grand Beds, and a fully-stocked kitchens complete with Wolf, Miele and Sub Zero appliances. Resort fee covers the following items: complimentary valet parking, premium high speed wireless internet, local calls, newspaper, business center with print me station, notary service, Stay Fit health club, bike rentals, laptops based on request, in-room safe barbeque grills, in room coffee/tea, beach services (chairs, umbrellas, towels), and water sport rentals (kayaks, paddleboards, floats).Bedroom 1- KingBedroom 2- KingBedroom 3- Queen Murphy BedUnit Size - 1,900 Sq. Ft.Please Note: Golf-Carts are NOT allowed on property grounds.*Minimum age requirement from February 1st through April 15th for all Beachside Managed properties is 27 years of age
data.image_tag: Beach Residences On Siesta, aka The Hyatt

data.title: Beach Walk
data.description: Featuring high ceilings and a spacious living area this 3-bedroom, 2.5-bath, beautifully renovated townhouse condominium presents the best Siesta Key has to experience. This multifloored unit offers the convenience of condominium living without a high-rise building. One of four townhomes in the Beach Walk complex, this home features lush tropical landscaping, paver walks, drive, and heated community pool. You will love the covered and screened outdoor rec space. Some of the features include a TV and ping pong table. Just out the door you’ll find grilling and a pool for your enjoyment. Located only a half block from the famous white sands of Siesta Beach, the No. 1 beach in the US and close to Siesta Village’s unique boutiques and restaurants, this unit is the perfect island getaway. Only 20 minutes by car to downtown Sarasota’s urban amenities, shopping, restaurants, museums, and entertainment. Just bring your sunscreen, bathing suit, and flip-flops! *Stairs only. All guests must have the ability to use stairs.*No parking in garage*Bedroom 1- KingBedroom 2- King with a work stationBedroom 3- QueenLiving Room- Queen Sleeper SofaUnit Size - 1,691 Sq. Ft.Added Amenities Included in Your Stay:Complimentary Bicycles Rentals,One Complimentary Parking Space,Wifi,Beach Chairs,Beach Towels,Beach Wagon,Beach Cooler,Partner Property Pool/Hot tub Access,Access to Siesta Beach Pickleball Courts,Siesta Key Trolly - Free-Rides Around Siesta Key,A 7-day week, Beachside Management office for your convenience and guest needs!Minimum Age Requirement: 25*Minimum age requirement from February 1st through April 15th for all Beachside Managed properties is 27 years of age

data.title: Whispering Pines - Enjoy a hot tub retreat | Near Mt. Hood | Pet-friendly
data.description:
Nestled amidst towering pine trees, Whispering Pines Cabin invites you to unwind near the iconic Mt. Hood. This rustic-modern blend is perfect for those seeking tranquility and adventure. Imagine soaking in a luxurious hot tub, truly invigorating after exploring scenic trails. The warm glow of the wood stove creates a cozy atmosphere, ideal for restful evenings. Whether sipping coffee on the deck or enjoying local exploits, this cabin promises a memorable escape. Secure your stay and indulge in the peaceful retreat that you've been dreaming of.The SpaceEscape to Whispering Pines Cabin, near Mt. Hood, for a relaxing retreat. Enjoy the invigorating hot tub and the rustic-modern comforts this cabin offers.

✔ Bask in the charm of open-beam ceilings and wood paneling
✔ Experience the warmth envelop you by the wood stove, with a novel in hand
✔ Spacious living area with plush seating and a Smart TV
✔ Fully equipped kitchen, ready for your culinary adventures
✔ Primary and second bedrooms with comfortable queen beds
✔ Bunk room designed with kids in mind
✔ Private deck perfect for morning coffee or evening relaxation
✔ Expansive yard for outdoor games, grilling, and unwinzing amidst nature
✔ Lush, luxurious hot tub for soothing evening soaks
✔ Shop with ski and snowboard storage and basketball hoop
✔ Assorted board games for fun-filled family timeGuest Access✔ Reliable free Wi-Fi to stay connected
✔ Fully equipped kitchen for delightful meals
✔ Wood stove with complimentary firewood
✔ Outdoor deck with seating and barbecue grill
✔ Ample on-site parking, hassle-free
✔ Welcoming pet policy, with prior approval and fee
✔ Convenient self check-in via smart lockNeighborhoodRelish the captivating charm around Mt. Hood, with Whispering Pines Cabin as your perfect launchpad. Situated near the tranquil Zig Zag River, adventure awaits nearby with hiking and skiing opportunities. Explore local dining gems or indulge in serene leisure amidst the picturesque backdrop. Whispering Pines is your gateway to natural beauty and endless experiences—reservations are just a click away!Other Things To Note✔ Kindly observe quiet hours for a peaceful neighborhood retreat
✔ Essentials like shampoo, conditioner, and body soap provided
✔ Pet friendly with prior approval, including a $100 pet feeGetting AroundWhether you’re seeking a quiet retreat surrounded by nature or an adventure-filled getaway near Mt. Hood, this cabin has it all. Relax by the fire after a day of exploring, or step outside to enjoy the tranquil sounds of the forest. With its convenient location and cozy atmosphere, this Rhododendron cabin offers the perfect escape for families, couples, and small groups.

Mt. Hood Skibowl: Just 20 minutes away for skiing, snowboarding, and tubing in the winter, and thrilling adventure parks in the summer.
Zigzag River & Hiking Trails: A short walk away (few minutes) from the cabin, ideal for nature walks and exploring the stunning local scenery.
Timberline Lodge: 30 minutes away for historic tours, skiing, and breathtaking views.
ZigZag Mountain Trailhead is less than a quarter mile away with many more hiking trails near by. 
Trillium Lake for kayaking and paddleboarding is just 15 miles away. House RulesCancellation Terms: Fully refundable up to 5 days before check in, then booking becomes non refundable. 
Payment Terms: 50% is due at booking and remainder 30 days before check in. If booking checks in less than 30 days 100% is due at booking.
Please respect quite hours and this is a community. 
Not glass or food while in the hot tub. 
No pets without pet fee, no cats
Minimum Age to Book: 21
Additional Rules may apply in Guest Guide Book
Pets: Dogs only, no cats. Only permitted with applicable pet fee.

data.title: Sunflower Sanctuary
data.description: Filled with unparalleled charm and eclectic details, you will instantly feel as if you're in a Pinterest board come to life while staying in this quintessential Arts & Crafts style home. Located within walking distance to downtown Asheville and Merrimon Avenue, Sunflower Sanctuary allows you to "live as the locals do" by strolling the tree-lined streets to nearby grocery stores, cafes, bookstores, shops, galleries, and award-winning restaurants. Upon entering this lovely cottage, you will find yourself in the front living room which offers plenty of natural light and brilliant pops of color. From the mint-colored fireplace (decorative only) to the gorgeous stained glass fixtures above the windows, this cozy space is both functional and inspiring. Just off the living room, you'll find the purple-clad dining room with unique decor and mismatched seating for up to 6.In the evening, make a delicious dinner in the sleek kitchen (complete with granite countertops, gas range stove, dishwasher, and standard coffeemaker) to enjoy in the dining room or on the open-air back deck. After dinner, grab some popcorn from the kitchen pantry and snuggle up in the back den to watch your favorite shows and movies on the Smart TV where you can access streaming apps and regular cable. The first bedroom in this stylish sanctuary comes with a full Murphy bed and a designated work area with reliable wifi (computer not included) that will allow you to work without having to give up your vacation. The second bedroom is the master where you'll find a king bed with a large walk-in closet and a full hall bath with a walk-in shower only. The second hall bathroom boasts a dreamy, vintage clawfoot tub and shower head extension.After spending an exciting night on the town, you'll look forward to coming home and pouring yourself a glass of wine to sip while soaking in a luxurious bubble bath. In the morning, enjoy a fresh glass of orange juice with a toasted muffin and fruit in the breakfast nook before sitting on the front porch with your newspaper and mug of coffee. Linger on the porch to people watch and listen to the hum of downtown Asheville, or retreat to your private, fenced-in courtyard to write and meditate without distraction while surrounded by towering trees and lush vegetation.This unique home is the perfect place for a writer's escape, romantic getaway, or family vacation for those who want a genuine regional experience. Just as the flower of its namesake sways and dances without care while facing the sunshine, a getaway to Sunflower Sanctuary will provide the radiant rejuvenation you've been dreaming of.PLEASE NOTE: The living room fireplace is NOT usable. Small dogs will be considered with an additional pet fee. Off-street parking is available for two cars with overflow parking street side. The basement is not part of the rental. Included in the monthly rent is a $400 monthly utility allowance power and $100 monthly water allowance. Any overages are to be reimbursed by the tenant. A monthly cleaning service is also required for stays longer than 30 nights.

data.title: Hummingbird Cottage
data.description: Constructed in 2016, this cozy 2-bedroom, 1.5-bath Arts & Crafts-style cottage is located in a quiet neighborhood within walking distance of Lake Tomahawk, the municipal swimming pool, tennis courts, and attractions in downtown Black Mountain. It's also just minutes from the Black Mountain Golf Course. A large, screened-in back porch with plenty of seating overlooks a lovely, level backyard with mature trees where you can watch the hummingbirds and enjoy s'mores around the fire pit.Each bedroom has a King bed and a TV, and the primary bedroom includes an attached half bath. The kitchen is well stocked with a dishwasher and 2 coffeemakers (standard Drip-style and Keurig), and the open living room with a TV ensures comfort—whether you're enjoying your morning coffee or entertaining a few friends. Snug and efficient, the cottage also features a full washer/dryer set, ultra-quiet central heating and cooling, puzzles and games, cable, and wireless high-speed internet. Hummingbird Cottage is perfect for romantic getaways or artist/writer retreats in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains! House Layout: Living room with TV; Eat-in kitchen with table that seats 4; Bedroom with a King bed and an en suite half bath; Full bath in the hallway; Bedroom with a King bed and a TV; Wonderful screened porch at the back of the house; Mini-split HVAC unit with a heating and cooling system that allows you to control the temperature in the living room and both bedrooms. PLEASE NOTE: Hummingbird Cottage is NOT pet-friendly.

data.title: Firefly Lodge
data.description: This cozy log cabin embraces you from the moment you enter. The many decks and porches offer great indoor/outdoor living and the open floor plan allows for natural light throughout the house. Whether you're enjoying morning coffee while savoring a beautiful sunrise from one of the three decks or cuddling in front of the fire on a winter's eve, you are encouraged to catch your breath and relax in a tranquil, natural setting in the foothills of the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains. This vacation retreat is the perfect getaway, as it is privately nestled in the woods and yet it's only a 5-minute drive to downtown Black Mountain and the Black Mountain golf course. Use the wireless internet to select the next day's activities, or try hiking one of the many trails within 20 minutes of the cabin. House Layout: Main floor: Open living room and kitchen area (Keurig and standard coffee maker); Dining table with seating for 4; Bedroom with a queen bed and full en suite bath (shower only) Upstairs: Bedroom with a queen bed and full en suite bath (shower only); Loft area with a sleeper sofa. Downstairs: Bedroom with a queen bed and full bath (walk-in shower); Den with a game table, air hockey table, and TV; Covered outdoor patio with gas grill. Please Note: SHEETS AND TOWELS INCLUDED for your convenience. This home is not pet-friendly. During winter months, the driveway will not be scraped for snow and ice. In the unlikely event that the house is inaccessible due to the weather during your stay, Greybeard Rentals will try to find alternative lodging.

data.title: Birdwood
data.description: Birdwood was completely renovated and added a brand-new HVAC system in 2024!Located within the gates of Montreat, Birdwood is a spacious 100-year-old, 3-story, 4,500-square-foot home with modern amenities. Features include a beautiful terrace and wrap-around porch. Birdwood sits on a large lot with a circular drive that provides ample space for guests to park and play. The layout of this historic home makes it perfect for a couple's getaway, church groups, family reunions, weddings, and corporate retreats. Birdwood can accommodate up to 20 guests with its 9 bedrooms (14 beds), 3 hall bathrooms, and 1 en suite bathroom.Each floor has a private entrance, kitchen, living/dining area, hall bathroom, multiple bedrooms, washer/dryer, connected workspace with a desk, and a unique outdoor space. The main floor features a large wrap-around porch. The top level has a screened-in porch. The lower level has a large patio with a fire pit, gas grill, and charcoal grill. The porch, patio, and main dining room can accommodate large gatherings. Perfect for togetherness AND privacy, this house serves as 3 homes in 1!HOUSE LAYOUT:#1. The lower level has 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, and a living/dining space. The dining area has seating for 8 guests and a TV in the living room. All bedrooms have access to the hall bathroom with a walk-in shower. The laundry room has a full-sized washer/dryer and an additional refrigerator.The 1st bedroom has a queen bed with an in-room sink & vanity. The 2nd bedroom has a set of twin beds with trundles, it can sleep 4.The 3rd bedroom has a queen bed. The primary suite has a king bed, TV, and private bathroom with a walk-in shower. #2. The main level has a kitchen opening into the dining area and a family room with a TV. All bedrooms have access to the hall bathroom with shower/tub combination, a stacked washer/dryer, and the covered wrap-around porch.The 1st bedroom has a queen bed, vanity/sink, and porch access.The 2nd bedroom has two twin beds, an in-room sink, and porch access. #3. The upper level has a kitchen, a living area, and a dining area with seating for 6. All bedrooms have access to the hall bathroom with shower/tub combination and stacked washer/dryer. The screened porch has a small dining area and an antique daybed.The 1st bedroom has a queen bed, porch access, and an in-room sink.The 2nd bedroom has a king bed and an in-room sink.The 3rd bedroom has two twin beds. PLEASE NOTE: Birdwood had a total interior renovation that was completed in the summer of 2024. As part of that renovation, every piece of upholstered furniture has either been replaced with new furniture or has been reupholstered. This home is pet-friendly with an additional fee. There is a Ring Doorbell exterior security camera. High-speed WIFI is provided with extenders that allow excellent service on all 3 levels. Additional chairs and card tables are available in the main-level hall closet. The renter's closet with oversized kitchen supplies and an additional refrigerator is accessible in the first-floor laundry room.Greybeard supplies sheets, pillowcases, towels, and kitchen linens. During the summer conference season (June and July), linens will be packaged and placed on each bed. Outside of the summer conference season, beds will be made before guest arrival.

data.title: Almost Bearadise
data.description: Perched 3,000 feet above sea level, overlooking the sleepy town of Black Mountain, this 5 bedroom, 4 bathroom, 3 level home has a monopoly on views and entertainment. If making memories and renewing your soul are your goals for vacation, Almost Bearadise is calling!About the Home• Fully equipped kitchen with island seating for 4, dining for 8, dishwasher, and two types of coffee makers (standard drip-style and Keurig).• Spacious living room with cable TV, gas log fireplace, and access to the covered deck with additional seating.• Upper-level loft with sitting area, overlooking the living room.• Lower level game room with second living area, electric fireplace, arcade games, foosball, hoops, and pool table; access the second covered deck with rocking chairs and oversized porch swing.• A whole-house generator protects the home from being impacted by power outages.Where to Unwind• The main floor offers a primary bedroom with a queen-size bed and en suite bathroom (walk-in shower), a second bedroom with a queen-size bed, and a full bathroom (shower and bathtub combination) with both hallway and bedroom access.• The upper level offers one bedroom with a queen size bed, and a full bathroom (shower and bathtub combination) with hallway access only.• The lower level offers two bedrooms, one with a queen size bed and one with two custom log bunk beds with double beds on the bottom and twin beds on the top, and a full bathroom (shower and bathtub combination) with hallway access only.Where to Explore• Nearest Gas, Shell | 4 minutes• Nearest Grocery, Ingles Market | 7 minutes• Downtown Black Mountain | 8 minutes• Lookout Mountain Trail Head | 14 minutes• The Blue Ridge Parkway | 18 minutes• Downtown Asheville | 26 minutes• Zen Tubing | 26 minutes• The Biltmore Estate | 30 minutesPlease note: This home has a Ring doorbell camera. Pets are not allowed. The icemaker is not operable, but there are ice trays for your convenience.

data.title: Row House on Lake James
data.description: ***THE PRIVATE DOCK IS TEMPORARILY UNAVAILABLE AND PENDING CONSTRUCTION. COMPLETION DATE TBD.***Nestled within the private & pristine 1780 community in Lake James, this three-bedroom, three-and-a-half-bath cabin sleeps up to 10 people comfortably and offers a stunning screened-in porch with a wood-burning fireplace and dining area, an outdoor kitchen with a gas grill & bar seating with lakefront views and a private dock and launch/beach area. Inside, the home is filled with gorgeous high-end furnishings and numerous upscale amenities. The primary bedroom has a King bed and en suite bath on the main level as well as access to a private covered porch with lovely lake views. The upper level offers an open loft with a full-size pullout sofa, a bedroom with a Queen bed and en suite bath, and a bunk room with two sets of bunk beds (2 fulls on bottom, 2 twins on top), and an en suite bath.Located just 45 minutes from Asheville in Nebo, this upscale lakefront home is the perfect place to get away and enjoy everything the Lake James area has to offer. Spend your days exploring nearby hiking trails like the Fonta Flora Loop in Lake James State Park or High Shoal Falls in South Mountains State Park before grabbing a refreshing craft beer at Fonta Flora's open-air brewery at Whippoorwill Farm. Take a short 25-minute drive to reach downtown Marion where you can spend your afternoon exploring the new 310 District, an indoor shopping space that's home to Toonez Chop House, Chances of Sprinkles Bakery, and several retail shops. For dinner, head to J. Hartman's for fresh seafood and a cocktail, or McDowell Local for a handcrafted dish paired with the NC staple, Cheerwine. If shopping is your thing, be sure to stop by the Lake James Antique Mall, or take a short 30-minute drive to the Simply Charming town of Morganton where you can find boutiques, novelty shops, regional museums, and art galleries to pick up a souvenir to remind you of your time by the lake in the mountains!Please note: This rental is pet-friendly with an additional fee. This home is lakefront and offers a private boat dock & beach area on Lake James to enjoy. For boat rentals, contact the Lake James Neighborhood Store (5 miles away) or Noah's Landing (11 miles away). While the home provides access to Lake James, it does NOT offer access to Camp Lake James amenities.

data.title: Clover Hill Cottage
data.description: Originally constructed in 1948, Clover Hill Cottage was completely rebuilt in 2022 and is now a Certified Green-Built home. Located on a sunny, spacious lot, the yard has been transformed into a pollinator's paradise with plants and flowers thoughtfully planted to create and support native birds and wildlife. Nods to the original cottage can be seen throughout the home, from the exposed brick to the custom-built bench and coat rack reclaimed from a barn on the property. Cathedral ceilings in the kitchen and primary bedroom allow for an abundance of natural light, creating a warm and inviting home away from the home. The eat-in kitchen is well-stocked for preparing meals and offers deck access so you can step outside to dine al fresco or plan the next day's adventures around the fire pit.Up for a little friendly competition? A game of cornhole may be just the thing on those warm evenings. Easy, one-level living includes a living room with a natural stone gas fireplace and a den (pocket doors for privacy) with a desk and queen-size sleeper sofa. The primary bedroom offers a queen-size bed and en suite bathroom with a spacious walk-in shower and full-size stackable washer and dryer, and there is another bedroom that offers a queen-size bed. Take in the gorgeous views of the surrounding Seven Sisters mountain range as you walk the elliptical trail at nearby Lake Tomahawk Park, where you can also enjoy an energetic tennis match, a summer swim at the Black Mountain Pool, and catch-and-release fishing (NC fishing license required). Known as the “Front Porch of Western North Carolina,” you’ll spot the iconic red rocking chairs throughout the treasured small town of Black Mountain that stand as your reminder to slow down, pull up a chair, and relax. Like the setting of your favorite novel, Black Mountain is an idyllic mountain town brimming with history and charm. Explore the timeless Town Hardware & General Store that offers so much more than housewares and tools, the quaint Sassafrass (on Sutton & Main) filled with spellbinding books and delightful toys, and the inspiring Seven Sisters Gallery and The Red House Studios & Gallery that sell handcrafted pieces and artwork by local artisans. Make sure you stop along the way for a bite to eat at one of Black Mountain's gourmet restaurants or cafes. From authentic Cuban cuisine to fresh vegetarian fare to culinary twists on southern staples, your taste buds will never get bored here. Just 10 minutes from town, you'll discover a hiker's paradise within the tranquil community of Montreat. Whether you are a beginner or an expert, there's a trail for everyone.Clover Hill Cottage is also a quick 20-minute drive from downtown Asheville, the iconic Blue Ridge Parkway, and America's Largest Home, the Biltmore Estate, so you're never too far from pursuing your next-day adventure. Book a reservation at one of Asheville's acclaimed restaurants, grab a one-of-a-kind gift from one of the River Arts District’s 270+ working artist galleries, blaze a trail through all of the craft breweries along Asheville's South Slope, roam the halls and ground of the historic Biltmore Estate, or drive along the Blue Ridge Parkway with the windows down listening to your perfectly-curated playlist as you take in the breathtaking views. Please note: This home is pet-friendly with an additional fee per pet (max of 2). High-speed internet and a dedicated workspace are provided for your convenience.

data.title: Cockrill Cabit
data.description: Spacious living areas mark this easy-to-access, comfortably furnished home. With a new kitchen and paneled great room, it is a splendid venue for reading, visiting with friends, or just rocking and relaxing in the mountain air. There is also a sunroom/dining area and screened deck, both overlooking a large yard with a view of Rainbow Ridge, as well as a study stocked with books. Located in the tranquil community of Montreat, you are just a short drive to the conference center and Lake Susan. The home is also about 5 minutes from downtown Black Mountain, where you can get groceries or dinner in some of our wonderful locally-owned restaurants.House Layout:Main Level-Kitchen(with gas range); great room with a flat-screen TV and gas logs fireplace; dining table seats 6; sunroom; main bedroom with a King bed and private bath; study/office; full bath; enclosed deck and covered front porch.Upper Level-Two bedrooms (with two twin beds in each); shared full bath. Linens are included with your rental.Please Note: This house does not rent to groups. Homes with gas logs are not in operation from May through the end of September due to the warmer summer months.

data.title: Sparrow Cottage
data.description: Sleep alongside the tree tops at Sparrow Cottage, a charming arts and crafts style 2 bedroom cottage that overlooks the mountains within the picturesque, upscale Village of Cheshire. This home is only a short 15-minute drive away from Asheville and mere minutes away from downtown Black Mountain. It is also within walking distance of the YMCA (pool, tennis, and fitness center) and the Village of Cheshire town center. Here you will find several dining options including Beradu, a new restaurant, bar, and specialty market, or Sake Sushi, which boasts high-quality Japanese cuisine. The interior of Sparrow Cottage was recently fully updated, including the addition of a spacious downstairs bedroom and bathroom (complete with walk-in shower) connected by interior stairs. Sparrow Cottage also has hardwood floors and fresh paint throughout. This 3-level home has 2 bedrooms, each with a luxurious king-sized bed and a full bathroom. The downstairs bedroom also features a new Roku-based LCD smart TV, a brand-new sofa, a sitting chair, and a coffee table. Up the stairs, you’ll find similar new features alongside a full bath with a spacious shower and laundry area with a washer and dryer. The upstairs bedroom does not have a TV but features a deck for viewing High Windy Mountain while sipping on your beverage of choice! The main level has a new LCD Smart TV with a new soundbar, new furniture, a new refrigerator, microwave, Nespresso, cooking utensils, and dishes. The living room features a gas-log fireplace and a new kitchen table and chairs. Step out on the deck and relax under the stars. Use the new Weber grill year-round to grill fresh foods for an enjoyable feast. Gather around the outdoor fire pit to stay warm on those chilly nights. Fresh linens and towels are provided for your convenience, and a mini-split A/C system was installed upstairs to enhance your overall comfort.Please Note: Due to the owners' severe allergies, no pets are allowed. This home has 2 exterior security cameras (one on the main level front porch and the other on the lower level entry area). The fire pit and chairs are stored beneath the deck when not in use to make room for overflow parking.

data.title: Wildside Retreat at Lake James
data.description: Enjoy the stunning Lake James area at your leisure in this sleek & stylish pet-friendly cabin that offers exclusive access to Camp Lake James amenities, an outdoor fire pit, a gas grill, a screened porch, a Tesla charger, and more! Nestled within the private & upscale Camp Lake James community, this three-bedroom, three-bath cabin sleeps up to 6 people comfortably and offers a cozy screened porch with an outdoor gas fireplace along with a fire pit in its backyard. Inside, the home is filled with sleek furnishings and numerous upscale amenities. The primary bedroom on the main level has a Queen bed, the upper-level guest room has a Queen bed, and the additional upper level has two twin beds. There's also an extra Queen bed on the lower level.Within a short walk of The Camp's Pavillion, as a guest at Wildside Retreat, you will be able to enjoy the exclusive amenities within Camp Lake James for the duration of your stay; take a dip in the pool, explore the lake by kayak, grab a quick bite at the Canteen, curl up by the stone outdoor fireplace, and enjoy community-led activities to your heart's content. Located in Nebo, just 45 minutes from Asheville, this beautiful and pet-friendly lakeside cabin is the perfect place to rest, relax, and recharge as you enjoy everything that the Lake James area has to offer. Spend your days adventuring on the nearby hiking trails before grabbing a refreshing craft beer at Fonta Flora's open-air brewery at Whippoorwill Farm (1.5 miles away), or travel less than 20 minutes to the charming small town of Marion where you can grab another cold one at Mica Town Brewing Company, or sample fresh seafood and a cocktail at Crabby Abby's Bar and Grille. After savory bites and sips, shop around at the Lake James Antique Mall, or take another short 30-minute drive to the "Simply Charming" town of Morganton where you can find more gift shops and art galleries to pick up a souvenir to remind you of your time in the mountains or for the ones you're thinking of that couldn't join you on this trip.House Layout: Main Level: Living room with gas logs and smart TV; dining table seats 8; a bedroom with a queen bed and TV; full hall bathroom Upstairs level: full hall bathroom; a room with 2 twin beds; a bedroom with a queen bed Lower Level: Laundry room; den with TV and game table; full hall bath; a bedroom with a queen bed; Outdoors: Screened porch with gas logs; Tesla charger; Grill; FirepitPlease note: This home is pet-friendly with an additional fee. This home has a Ring doorbell camera. This home offers exclusive access to Camp Lake James community amenities, including a spacious pool & covered pavilion area with a cabana, but please note that the docks and fitness center are private and off-limits. Some blackout dates and holiday limitations apply. Please inquire for more information. While the home is near the lake, it is NOT lakefront and does NOT have its own private boat dock. However, you are welcome to rent a pontoon boat through Lake James Neighborhood Store (4.3 miles away) or Noah's Landing (10.3 miles away).

data.title: Birdie View
data.description: Birdie View's location offers something for everyone. Close to town and the golf course, and a short drive to Asheville and hiking. For the golf enthusiast, this charming 3 bedroom 1 ½ bath home is located just across from the 10th hole of the Black Mountain golf course. The views of the course and the surrounding mountains are one of the things the owners love the most. For all you outdoor lovers, Lake Tomahawk is just a short walk away. On a clear day, the views of the Seven Sisters Mountain range from the lake walking trail are stunning. Don’t forget to bring your tennis rackets as there are courts near the lake!  The Blue Ridge Parkway and all the many nature trails, waterfalls, and scenic views that it offers can be reached within minutes.  Finally, no trip to this area would be complete without a trip to the Biltmore House and all the fun of Asheville, both are less than 30 mins away.House Layout: Bedroom with a queen bed; Bedroom with a king bed; Office with desk area & full-size sleeper sofa.Please note: This home is pet-friendly with an additional fee. The owners have an exterior camera for the front door and driveway only. If you rent Birdie View monthly, included in the monthly rent is a $400 monthly utility allowance power and $100 monthly water allowance. Any overages are to be reimbursed by the tenant.

data.title: Black Bear Summit
data.description: Black Bear Summit, formerly known as "Cool View Cabin," has spectacular views of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Lake Lure, and beyond that will make you stop and pause. This mountaintop log cabin in Gateway Mountain, a 3,000-acre nature preserve, is a wonderful getaway for family and friends yet close to all Western North Carolina attractions and activities. Stay on the mountain and enjoy all that Gateway Mountain has to offer including 2 lakes and a trout pond for catch-and-release fishing (no license required), a beautiful waterfall park, hiking trails, and abundant wildlife.This lovely cabin has 3 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms featuring a Jacuzzi tub in one bath and a claw foot soaker tub in the other bath. A wood stove in the living area warms the soul on chilly nights and don't miss the beautiful sunrises and sunsets from the wrap-around deck. After a day of adventure enjoy the 6-person hot tub with the same spectacular views. There is also a fire pit for your enjoyment. Located 10 minutes off of I-40, trips to Black Mountain, Asheville, and the Blue Ridge Parkway are an easy 30-45 minutes; Lake Lure and Chimney Rock - 30 minutes.While staying at Black Bear Summit, you'll enjoy an extensive selection of books, movies, games, and puzzles. Log into your own streaming accounts on the smart TV or peruse the extensive satellite channel selection. Take advantage of the owner's family's book of personal recommendations for food, drink, hiking, biking, and the area in general. Work remotely if you wish, via the fast wifi and workstation. Local and custom artwork throughout the cabin and a fully-stocked kitchen will make you feel at home. House LayoutMain Level: Recently upgraded deck with an incredible view and furniture for dining and lounging; living room with smart TV and wood stove; 6-person dining table; kitchen island with 4 stools; kitchen with gourmet 6-burner gas range and dishwasher; full bath; 2 queen bedrooms.Upstairs: Primary king bedroom with full bath; loft with remote laptop working station. Ground level/basement area: washer/dryer and sliding doors leading to the hot tub and fire pit area (guests can bring charcoal and use the cooking grate available at the fire pit). Please note: This house is pet-friendly with an additional pet fee. Guests are responsible for purchasing their own firewood. While firewood may be present at the cabin and can be utilized if present, it is not guaranteed. During the colder winter months (from December through March), icy and/or snowy road conditions and delayed snow plow operations are possible within the development.We strongly recommend AWD or 4WD vehicles and travel insurance throughout the year but especially for those staying in the Gateway Mountain development during the winter months. No parking is allowed on roadways or at gate entrances. No RVs, boat trailers, camping trailers, or trailers of any kind are permitted in the Gateway Mountain Community.

data.title: Serendipity Treehaus
data.description: The definition of Serendipity is the occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy way. The homeowners feel it was very serendipitous that they found this lovely home! They would love to share their special place with you. It's a perfect getaway for one or two couples. Both bedrooms have king beds and en-suite bathrooms. Serendipity is located in the charming and quaint Village of Cheshire, just one mile from downtown Black Mountain. You can walk down the street and dine at Beradu, Sake Sushi, or Black Bear Tavern.This amazing home was previously selected as Home of the Month by the Raleigh News and Observer. This award is a collaborative effort between the paper and NC State University's School of Design through its home environments design initiative. Blending softly into the hillside of this desirable Village of Cheshire community, the architect, Thomas Lawton, made use of native stones, cedar shingles, and native landscaping. Outdoor rooms were created with covered porches and a terrace area carved out of the hillside. Inside, a loft-like interior includes clean, modern lines and lots of windows.House layout: Main floor- full kitchen features Viking appliances; half bath; open living room area with gas fireplace and TV (cable and Wifi available); dining table that seats 4; deck with a table and extra seating. Upper level- master loft with king bed, TV, and a luxurious full bathroom with walk-in shower and soaking tub. Lower level- bedroom with king bed, TV, and a full bathroom. Outdoors- main level deck; wonderful back patio with outdoor fireplace.Please Note: The owners offer a 10% military discount year-round to military service members.

data.title: Patricia Home
data.description: Located in the quaint mountain cove of Montreat, Patricia Home is nestled up on Rainbow Ridge and is the perfect place to gather. This home, built in 1909, beautifully blends modern amenities with historical pieces. Once home to a family where the women were all named Patricia, the walls of this property are a veritable history museum. Enjoy your time both inside the home and out, on the three layers of decks with the sounds of nearby Flat Creek. The driveway is extremely steep, but is manageable and has plenty of space at the top. There are a total of five parking spaces available. Open concept the first level has plenty of space for entertaining, with a table that seats approximately 16 people. The updated galley-style kitchen has modern appliances and beautiful granite countertops, with a bar space connecting to the dining room for quick service. Spacious den has seating on split levels - with the television on the upper level near the hall half bath. Spend time together on the expansive front porch in the red rocking chairs, as burgers heat up on the grill. All bedrooms are on the upper two levels of the home - with two rooms on the second floor, one leading to the deck; and four on the third floor, with access to the small top-story deck from the hall. Take your time as you venture up the stairs to piece together the story of the home and its previous occupants with the memorabilia placed on the walls.You're within walking distance to the award-winning Robert Lake Park - with a lovely creekside playground, tennis courts, a small ballfield, and an easy walking trail Elizabeth's Path. Peruse the ethically sourced handcrafted goods at Ten Thousand Village or the area-specific items at The Montreat Store. Grab a coffee or hand-scooped ice cream from The Huckleberry and take a walk around Lake Susan, or in the summer rent a paddle boat or go fishing. Montreat's trail system offers several hiking options from easy to strenuous and is within a few minutes drive of the home. Venture into Black Mountain, an eight-minute drive, to enjoy the small businesses and locally owned restaurants that line the downtown streets. From pub-style Appalachian to authentic Cuban, several local coffee roasters, and fantastic bakeries - Black Mountain has it all. If you've exhausted Black Mountain's offerings, travel another twenty minutes down the interstate to Asheville - where you can enjoy several James Beard-nominated restaurants and the booming beer scene.House Layout: Main Floor- Kitchen, dining table seats 16-20, TV in the living room, half bath for commons area. Second Floor- Bedroom 1 with two Queens and a set of bunk beds and a tv, full bath connects with tub/shower; Bedroom 2 with Queen and full bath. Third Floor- Bedrooms 3,4,5,6 have queen beds and there are two full hall baths.Linens, sheets and towels, are provided for your convenience. Patricia Home is pet friendly with an additional pet fee. Due to insurance regulations, there are certain breeds that are not permitted. During the summer Montreat Conference Season - typically June through August - the home rents weekly and the linens will be delivered to the home in gray laundry bags. Mid-August through May the home has a minimum 3-night stay and a minimum of 4 nights for holidays, the beds will be made for your convenience.

data.title: Rogers' Roost
data.description: Nestled in the tranquil town of Montreat, this spacious yet cozy home is just a 10-minute walk to Lake Susan & conference center activities and a 10-minute drive to the shops, restaurants, cafes, and galleries in charming downtown Black Mountain. Tucked away among the lush trees and rhododendron, guests will love the fantastic outdoor spaces with plenty of seating for enjoying the fresh mountain air, along with easy access to hiking trails and rock-hopping in the creek. Whether traveling with a youth group, family, or friends, this space is perfect for enjoying meditation, fellowship, and respite!About the House• Covered, wrap-around porch with a hammock and a variety of seating• "Prep pantry" with sink, mini refrigerator, and ample counter space• Library sitting room with dedicated work space• 2-car garage with ping-pong table• Spacious, open-concept living room with dining space for 5, TV, and access to the screened-in porch with outdoor dining, a second hammock, and seating• Well-equipped kitchen with dining for 4, dishwasher, and standard drip-style coffee makerWhere to UnwindMain Level• Bedroom 1 with a king-size bed• Two full bathrooms can be accessed from the hallway; one with a bathtub and shower combination and one with a walk-in showerUpper Level• Bedroom 2 with two twin-size beds• Bedroom 3 with two twin-size beds• Bedroom 4 with a full-size bed• Bedroom 5 with a king-size bed and en suite bathroom with a walk-in shower• Two full bathrooms can be accessed from the hallway; one with a bathtub and shower combination and one with a walk-in shower and separate soaking tubIMPORTANT THINGS TO NOTE:• Sheets and towels are NOT provided, but can be rented from Greybeard Rentals• The driveway can accommodate up to 4 very well-spaced vehicles• The fireplace in the living room is not usable

data.title: Best of Times
data.description: Located within the pristine & charming Village of Cheshire which boasts open greenspace, walking trails, a community garden, and shops & restaurants, this lovely townhome is situated on the corner, allowing more space and privacy. Best of Times is less than a mile from all of the activities, shops, restaurants, and breweries in downtown Black Mountain.About the Home• Best of Times offers high-speed WIFI with speeds of up to 400 Mbps that will allow you to seamlessly work remotely.• The open-concept main floor boasts a sleek living room with a gas log fireplace and SmartTV for streaming.• Galley-style kitchen with dishwasher and two types of coffee makers: Keurig and standard drip-style.• Formal dining area for 6 and covered, outdoor dining for 6.• A powder room is available on both the main floor and the upper level for additional convenience. • Impressive mountain views are on display from the upper-level bonus room with a reclining sofa, game table, various books, and access to a second covered deck with outdoor seating.Where to Unwind• The main floor primary bedroom offers a king-size and en suite bathroom with a walk-in shower and jetted, soaking tub.• The upper level offers two bedrooms, each with a queen-size bed. A full bathroom, with a bathtub and shower combination, can be accessed from the hallway.Where to Explore• Beradu Specialty Market, Kitchen & Bar | < 2 minute walk• Sake Sushi | < 2 minute walk• Nearest Gas, Ingles iMarket | 3 minutes• Nearest Grocery, Ingles Market | 3 minutes• Downtown Black Mountain | 4 minutes• Lookout Mountain Trail Head | 13 minutes• The Blue Ridge Parkway | 13 minutes• Downtown Asheville | 19 minutes• The Biltmore Estate | 25 minutesPlease note: This home is NOT pet-friendly. The garage is NOT accessible to guests. Due to the fire code, no street-side parking is permitted in front of this home. You can park there long enough to load/unload your car at the front door, but your vehicle should be parked in the commercial parking lot directly behind the townhouse at all other times.

data.title: Orchard Knob
data.description: In the gated community of Laurel Ridge, this freshly renovated home on Orchard Knob Lane sits high on the mountain with spectacular views. Two wonderful decks overlook these views and offer great opportunities for total relaxation. Easy access at the front door includes separate parking and a ramp. The upstairs deck boasts a lovely fireplace and extra comfortable seating area along with dining space. The kitchen is extremely well-equipped. A spacious downstairs bedroom with a den and gas fireplace, and double car garage make Orchard Knob a great place to get away from it all! Only 15 minutes from downtown Black Mountain and 35 minutes from downtown Asheville.HOUSE LAYOUT:Main Level- Kitchen, dining area, living room, half bath, BR with king and bay window has an amazing view and a spacious full bath. Second BR with King and handicap-accessible shower.Lower Level- Third BR with the queen, gas logs, and sleeper sofa shares Jack and Jill bath with the Fourth bedroom which has a king-sized bed. All bedrooms access the large deck (the outdoor TV is locked behind a cabinet and not available to use). Some pets are allowed with an additional fee.Please Note: SHEETS AND TOWELS INCLUDED for your convenience. Orchard Knob has a 3-night minimum stay. Per Laurel Ridge HOA restrictions: NO campers, RVs, recreational vehicles, or ATVs. Any such vehicle could be towed at the renter's expense.

data.title: Downtown Treehouse
data.description: Come enjoy this wonderful, ground-level apartment. The location is outstanding! Downtown Treehouse is the lower-level apartment of the house, with an upper-level apartment also available for rent. It's newly renovated and has all the modern-day conveniences to be a home away from home, as well as separate entrances and outdoor sitting areas. This adorable apartment is nestled in a walkable neighborhood. Enjoy the great boutiques, coffee shops, microbreweries, and restaurants that Black Mountain has to offer. Easy entry into the apartment since there are no steps. There is a private patio with a grill and outdoor seating. The living room has a TV and a love seat that converts to a twin bed if needed. The bedroom has a queen bed and there is a full bathroom (shower only, no tub). Sheets and towels are provided for your convenience. Please also view Uptown Treehouse on our website!Please note: Downtown Treehouse is not pet-friendly.

data.title: Gartrell Home
data.description: Located within a 2-minute drive and a 17-minute walk from Lake Susan, Robert Lake Playground, and the Conference Center, Gartrell Home is a spacious and historic Montreat home that's perfect for a mountain getaway with friends or family in the beautiful summer months. The main floor of the home offers a kitchen with eat-in dining, a formal living room, a den with a TV for streaming, a full bathroom, a laundry room (with a washer, dryer, and toilet), and a traditional "sleeping porch" with a queen size bed. The upper level has sleeping space for 9 with 4 bedrooms: one with a queen bed, one with a double bed, one with a king-size bed and two twin beds, and one with a twin bed. There is also a full bathroom with a clawfoot tub and shower. During your stay, explore Montreat's endless trail system that winds through lush rhododendron, alongside babbling creeks, and that scale cliff faces overlooking the valley and towns below. For avid hikers, Lookout Mountain is a great trail that rings in at just under a mile long and offers stunning panoramic mountain views, and there's also the epic 4.8-mile Graybeard trail with several spur trails, including one that leads to Walker Knob and another that leads to Graybeard Falls. Gartrell Home is also a 10-minute drive from Black Mountain. Known as the “Front Porch of Western North Carolina,” you’ll spot the iconic red rocking chairs throughout this treasured small town that stand as your reminder to slow down, pull up a chair, and relax. While in town, stop by Lookout Brewing and Black Mountain Brewing for a cold local beer, browse the novelty shops, and grab a bite at Pure & Proper, Taco Billy, or My Father's Pizza in the heart of downtown. If you're interested in experiencing a bit of city life during your trip, the home is just 25 minutes from the iconic Biltmore Estate and downtown Asheville where you can explore art galleries, dine at award-winning restaurants, and shop for some handcrafted souvenirs to remind you of your memorable time in the mountains.  Please note: This home is NOT pet friendly due to severe allergies. Linens are NOT provided but can be rented from Greybeard Rentals for an additional fee. This home rents from Saturday to Saturday from mid-May to mid-August and accepts youth groups. There is central air conditioning but the "sleeping porch" is not heated or cooled.

data.title: Hummingbirds' Mountain Retreat
data.description: Perched atop a mountain peak within the private, gated community of Gateway Mountain, Hummingbirds' Mountain Retreat provides ample space and modern comforts to ensure the perfect getaway for family and friends. Within driving distance of all that WNC has to offer in the way of attractions and activities, you can easily travel to town for entertainment or stay on the mountain to enjoy Gateway Mountain's exclusive amenities. As a guest in this secluded & scenic community, you'll have access to lush wooded forests, gorgeous waterfalls, and stunning mountaintop vistas along with two small lakes and a trout pond for catch-and-release fishing (no license required). This nature-filled haven is teeming with plant life and wildlife that you can enjoy firsthand at your leisure.Upon entering this contemporary haven, you'll immediately be greeted by the breathtaking mountain views from the floor-to-ceiling windows in the living room. In the morning, sip your coffee while watching the sunrise in one of the rocking chairs on the deck before taking advantage of the fast Starlink Wi-Fi and home office equipped with a desk, ergonomic chair, and 2 monitors where you can work remotely. After that, whip up a delicious breakfast in the gourmet kitchen complete with stainless appliances and a gas range stove. Enjoy breakfast at the island with a mimosa while you talk through the day's activities with your group.Conveniently located just a short 20-minute drive from the quaint town of Old Fort, grab a delicious burger and cold beer for lunch at Hillman Brewing which overlooks Mill Creek before hiking local favorite Catawba Falls, a dog-friendly trail that winds through a shady forest valley to a series of gorgeous, moss-covered cascades. After the refreshing hike, take a short 35-minute drive to reach downtown Marion where you can spend your afternoon exploring the new 310 District, an indoor shopping space that's home to restaurants, an indoor skating rink, and several retail shops. Black Mountain is also just a short 30-minute. drive away. Home to 2 local breweries, boutiques, art galleries, parks, and incredible restaurants like Que Sera & Black Mountain Bistro, there's no shortage of things to do and see in this charming town. After exploring these small towns, be sure to check out downtown Asheville and the iconic Biltmore Estate, or head south to visit Chimney Rock & Lake Lure, quaint villages filled with even more activities to enjoy.Spend your days hiking on the various trails within Chimney Rock State Park, swim & canoe on Lake Lure's mountain beach, or stroll atop the quirky Lake Lure Flowering Bridge. Both Asheville & Chimney Rock/Lake Lure are just a 45-minute drive away! Return home in the evening to grill up dinner using the dual grill (charcoal or gas), and gather at the dining table to enjoy it together over great conversation. After dinner, cozy up around the wood stove in the living room before heading to the den downstairs to play foosball, board games, and ping pong and to stream your favorite shows on the TV. You can also stock up on your favorite snacks & drinks in the newly added mini-fridge! End your perfect day by stargazing in the hot tub or on the deck with a glass of wine.Boasting sleek furnishings, top-notch amenities, and stunning year-round mountain views, Hummingbirds' Mountain Retreat is a true mountain oasis that promises seclusion & endless opportunities for adventure!Please Note: This home is pet-friendly with an additional fee. While the home is not fully ADA certified, there is a wheelchair-accessible ramp to the right of the home from the parking area, and there is a primary bedroom & en suite bath on the main level with a convenient walk-in shower. No parking is allowed on roadways or at gate entrances. No RVs, boat trailers, camping trailers, or trailers of any kind are permitted in the Gateway Mountain Community.
